cards.flavor: 'When your first plan fails... imp-rovise.'
cards.name: Rafaam's Scheme
cards.text: Summon @ 1/1 |4(Imp, Imps). (Upgrades each turn!)

cards.flavor: “We did it! We blew up the vault!” “You mean the vault door?” “Oh. The doooor…”
cards.name: Dr. Boom's Scheme
cards.text: Gain @ Armor. (Upgrades each turn!)

cards.collectionText: Deal $1 damage to all minions. (Upgrades each turn!)
cards.flavor: 'All shall suffer!' 'But Hagatha, those are your minions...' 'I said ALL!!!'
cards.name: Hagatha's Scheme
cards.text: Deal $@ damage to all minions. (Upgrades each turn!)

cards.collectionText: Choose a minion. Shuffle 1 |4(copy, copies) of it into your deck. (Upgrades each turn!)
cards.flavor: 'Many minions equals many treasures for king. Kobold arithmetic!'
cards.name: Togwaggle's Scheme
cards.text: Choose a minion. Shuffle @ |4(copy, copies) of it into your deck. (Upgrades each turn!)

cards.collectionText: Reduce the Attack of an enemy minion by 1 until your next turn. (Upgrades each turn!)
cards.flavor: 'What's that you're dreaming? You're weak and you're screaming! It must be my scheming...'
cards.name: Lazul's Scheme
cards.text: Reduce the Attack of an enemy minion by @ until your next turn. (Upgrades each turn!)

cards.flavor: Terrible at shadow puppets: “This is… a tentacle! And this is… two tentacles!”
cards.name: Shadowy Figure
cards.text: Battlecry: Transform into a 2/2 copy of a friendly Deathrattle minion.

cards.flavor: It’s always nice to steal a familiar face.
cards.name: Convincing Infiltrator
cards.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Destroy a  random enemy minion.

cards.flavor: The Hench-Clan has a point.
cards.name: Hench-Clan Shadequill
cards.text: Deathrattle: Restore 5 Health to the enemy hero.

cards.flavor: The weirdest part is that it doesn't have legs.
cards.name: Walking Fountain
cards.text: Lifesteal, Rush, Windfury

cards.flavor: Attracts murlocs… and moths.
cards.name: Underbelly Angler
cards.text: After you play a Murloc, add a random Murloc to your hand.

cards.flavor: Fan favorite in the muck morphin' sewer strangers.
cards.name: Muckmorpher
cards.text: Battlecry: Transform into a 4/4 copy of a different minion in your deck.

cards.flavor: Built by goblins, designed by a troll.
cards.name: Hecklebot
cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: Your opponent summons a minion from their deck.

cards.flavor: The first dimensional ripper had a point. The second fell flat. The THIRD one really started to take shape!
cards.name: Dimensional Ripper
cards.text: Summon 2 copies of a minion in your deck.

cards.flavor: They always wind up bombing.
cards.name: Clockwork Goblin
cards.text: Battlecry: Shuffle a Bomb into your opponent's deck. When drawn, it explodes for 5 damage.

cards.flavor: Infinitely preferable to mopping strikes.
cards.name: Sweeping Strikes
cards.text: Give a minion 'Also damages minions next to whomever this attacks.'

cards.flavor: Whoso pulleth out this wrench from the toolbox is rightwise king of the lab.
cards.name: Wrenchcalibur
cards.text: After your hero attacks, shuffle a Bomb into your opponent's deck.

cards.flavor: He's gonna fly through the air with the greatest of grease.
cards.name: Blastmaster Boom
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Boom Bots for each Bomb in your opponent's deck.

cards.flavor: It's 3 am. Do you know where your soul is?
cards.name: Unsleeping Soul
cards.text: Silence a friendly minion, then summon a copy of it.

cards.flavor: “What’s better than reaving? BOOM reaving!”
cards.name: The Boom Reaver
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a copy of a minion in your deck. Give it Rush.

cards.flavor: You'll get the transformation you want when murlocs fly.
cards.name: Mutate
cards.text: Transform a friendly minion into a random one that costs (1) more.

cards.flavor: I'm addicted to him, but I know that he's Toxfin.
cards.name: Toxfin
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Murloc Poisonous.

cards.flavor: Some heroes have soft hearts and hard shells.
cards.name: Travelling Healer
cards.text: Divine Shield Battlecry: Restore #3 Health.

cards.flavor: The fanciest possible way of distracting enemies with shiny things.
cards.name: Spellward Jeweler
cards.text: Battlecry: Your hero can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers until your next turn.

cards.flavor: Stops for nothing—except donuts.
cards.name: Dalaran Crusader
cards.text: Divine Shield

cards.flavor: She's watching. Always watching.
cards.name: Sunreaver Spy
cards.text: Battlecry: If you control a Secret, gain +1/+1.

cards.flavor: The Hench Clan is an equal opportunity employer, no matter which parts of you came from where.
cards.name: Hench-Clan Hag
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Amalgams with all minion types.

cards.flavor: Keep it secret. Keep it safeguarded!
cards.name: Safeguard
cards.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Summon a 0/5 Vault Safe with Taunt.

cards.flavor: You're bound to love his work!
cards.name: Spellbook Binder
cards.text: Battlecry: If you have Spell Damage, draw a card.

cards.flavor: He’d be a lot sneakier if he wasn’t trailing 300 yards of power cable…
cards.name: Hench-Clan Sneak
cards.text: Stealth

cards.flavor: 'Would sir like me to punch something?'
cards.name: Arcane Servant

cards.flavor: If you have to wield a spell and a sword, then neither is performing to expectation.
cards.name: Violet Spellsword
cards.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each spell in your hand.

cards.flavor: He's got magic, a shield, and an unwavering obsession with the color purple.
cards.name: Violet Warden
cards.text: Taunt Spell Damage +1

cards.flavor: Desperate times call for disparate secrets.
cards.name: Desperate Measures
cards.text: Twinspell Cast a random Paladin Secret.

cards.flavor: This is why you shouldn’t shoot the messenger.
cards.name: Bronze Herald
cards.text: Deathrattle: Add two 4/4 Dragons to your hand.

cards.flavor: All of his speeches really drag on.
cards.name: Dragon Speaker
cards.text: Battlecry: Give all Dragons in your hand +3/+3.

cards.flavor: You can make a collect CAW!
cards.name: Messenger Raven
cards.text: Battlecry: Discover a Mage minion.

cards.flavor: It's always darkest just before you find the light switch.
cards.name: Darkest Hour
cards.text: Destroy all friendly minions. For each one, summon a random minion from your deck.

cards.flavor: If only you’d let it go to voicemail…
cards.name: Conjurer's Calling
cards.text: Twinspell Destroy a minion. Summon 2 minions of the same Cost to replace it.

cards.flavor: There's a powerful throat in this frog.
cards.name: Magic Dart Frog
cards.text: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to a random enemy minion.

cards.flavor: She's got a big brood and a big mood.
cards.name: Aranasi Broodmother
cards.text: Taunt When you draw this, restore 4 Health to your hero.

cards.flavor: Delicious Forest’s Aid! Made from real forests.
cards.name: The Forest's Aid
cards.text: Twinspell Summon five 2/2 Treants.

cards.flavor: Often used as healing crystals, but also good for throwing at people.
cards.name: Crystal Power
cards.text: Choose One - Deal $2 damage to a minion; or Restore #5 Health.

cards.flavor: Arguably the cutest blessing.
cards.name: Blessing of the Ancients
cards.text: Twinspell Give your minions +1/+1.

cards.flavor: Experience the draw of the wild!
cards.name: Crystalsong Portal
cards.text: Discover a Druid minion. If your hand has no minions, keep all 3.

cards.flavor: You’d be nuts to mess with the squirrel squad.
cards.name: Acornbearer
cards.text: Deathrattle: Add two 1/1 Squirrels to your hand.

cards.flavor: Lifeweaving is all well and good until it's time to cut the thread.
cards.name: Lifeweaver
cards.text: Whenever you restore Health, add a random Druid spell to your hand.

cards.flavor: Always feels refreshed after a little dirt nap.
cards.name: Lucentbark
cards.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Go dormant. Restore 5 Health to awaken this minion.

cards.flavor: The terms of service are constantly changing.
cards.name: Unidentified Contract
cards.text: Destroy a minion. Gains a bonus effect in your hand.

cards.flavor: Obviously it's marked for greatness.
cards.name: Marked Shot
cards.text: Deal $4 damage to a minion. Discover a spell.

cards.flavor: Stop trying to make fletch happen. It's not going to happen.
cards.name: Arcane Fletcher
cards.text: Whenever you play a 1-Cost minion, draw a spell from your deck.

cards.flavor: Pew! Pew!
cards.name: Rapid Fire
cards.text: Twinspell Deal $1 damage.

cards.flavor: Reduce, reuse, re-rattle!
cards.name: Oblivitron
cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon a Mech from your hand and trigger its Deathrattle.

cards.flavor: Beware the night of the living pets!
cards.name: Nine Lives
cards.text: Discover a friendly Deathrattle minion that died this game. Also trigger its Deathrattle.

cards.flavor: The Kirin Tor have always been lax in enforcing leash laws.
cards.name: Unleash the Beast
cards.text: Twinspell Summon a 5/5 Wyvern with Rush.

cards.flavor: Good things come in threes: Windrunner sisters and arrows of Thori'dal.
cards.name: Vereesa Windrunner
cards.text: Battlecry: Equip Thori'dal, the Stars' Fury.

cards.flavor: Gradually driven to darkness by the promise of unobtainable cheese.
cards.name: EVIL Cable Rat
cards.text: Battlecry: Add a Lackey to your hand.

cards.flavor: Kobold! There’s a place you can handle I said kobold! When you’re short in the candle Cast a spell with the E! V! I! L!
cards.name: EVIL Conscripter
cards.text: Deathrattle: Add a Lackey to your hand.

cards.flavor: Because there are no G.O.O.D. Miscreants.
cards.name: EVIL Miscreant
cards.text: Combo: Add two random Lackeys to your hand.

cards.flavor: She’s more of a rat burglar.
cards.name: Hench-Clan Burglar
cards.text: Battlecry: Discover a spell from another class.

cards.flavor: A staunch ally of Rafaam, at least while the shinies keep flowing.
cards.name: Heistbaron Togwaggle
cards.text: Battlecry: If you control a Lackey, choose a fantastic treasure.

cards.flavor: Minions must wash hands before being LIQUIDATED AND REPLACED BY SOMEONE BETTER.
cards.name: Arch-Villain Rafaam
cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: Replace your hand and deck with Legendary minions.

cards.flavor: Rafaam mainly enjoys working with Hagatha because she never laughs at Dr. Boom's jokes.
cards.name: Swampqueen Hagatha
cards.text: Battlecry: Add a 5/5 Horror to your hand. Teach it two Shaman spells.

cards.flavor: The swill has eyes!
cards.name: Witch's Brew
cards.text: Restore #4 Health. Repeatable this turn.

cards.flavor: You can't stop slurping this delicious sludge!
cards.name: Sludge Slurper
cards.text: Battlecry: Add a Lackey to your hand. Overload: (1)

cards.flavor: Now his watch has ended… until you have Spell Damage.
cards.name: Arcane Watcher
cards.text: Can't attack unless you have Spell Damage.

cards.flavor: Far more effective than the flamboyant saboteur.
cards.name: Unseen Saboteur
cards.text: Battlecry: Your opponent casts a random spell from their hand (targets chosen randomly).

cards.flavor: What, did you expect the Sunreavers to be coldages?
cards.name: Sunreaver Warmage
cards.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a spell that costs (5) or more, deal 4 damage.

cards.flavor: Everyone gets two because that’s all she can hold.
cards.name: Potion Vendor
cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #2 Health to all friendly characters.

cards.flavor: 'Thanks a latte!'
cards.name: Barista Lynchen
cards.text: Battlecry: Add a copy of each of your other Battlecry minions to your hand.

cards.flavor: This is some bad blood.
cards.name: Azerite Elemental
cards.text: At the start of your turn, gain Spell Damage +2.

cards.flavor: It's always accepting of the less successful adventurers.
cards.name: Underbelly Ooze
cards.text: After this minion survives damage, summon a copy of it.

cards.flavor: It'll take a humble offender to defeat him.
cards.name: Proud Defender
cards.text: Taunt Has +2 Attack while you have no other minions.

cards.flavor: 'My, my, what big minions I have!'
cards.name: Big Bad Archmage
cards.text: At the end of your turn, summon a random 6-Cost minion.

cards.flavor: His cooking is always very well done.
cards.name: Chef Nomi
cards.text: Battlecry: If your deck is empty, summon six 6/6 Greasefire Elementals.

cards.flavor: He's an archmage, but he might want to brush up on the basics... like aiming.
cards.name: Archmage Vargoth
cards.text: At the end of your turn, cast a spell you've cast this turn (targets are random).

cards.flavor: We reserve the right to refuse service to any 1/1.
cards.name: Heroic Innkeeper
cards.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +2/+2 for each other friendly minion.

cards.flavor: Jumbo in size! Huge in E.V.I.L.!
cards.name: Jumbo Imp
cards.text: Costs (1) less whenever a friendly Demon dies while this is in your hand.

cards.flavor: Eager to please, even if it kills him.
cards.name: Eager Underling
cards.text: Deathrattle: Give two random friendly minions +2/+2.

cards.flavor: It’s like an interdimensional game of demon tag.
cards.name: Portal Overfiend
cards.text: Battlecry: Shuffle 3 Portals into your deck. When drawn, summon a 2/2 Demon with Rush.

cards.flavor: Them’s fightin’ words!
cards.name: Eccentric Scribe
cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon four 1/1 Vengeful Scrolls.

cards.flavor: Some might call this a lightforgery.
cards.name: Lightforged Blessing
cards.text: Twinspell Give a friendly minion Lifesteal.

cards.flavor: But sometimes concede.
cards.name: Never Surrender!
cards.text: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, give your minions +2 Health.

cards.flavor: It knows every secret you have left.
cards.name: Mysterious Blade
cards.text: Battlecry: If you control a Secret, gain +1 Attack.

cards.flavor: Two people can keep a secret as long as neither of them are Commander Rhyssa.
cards.name: Commander Rhyssa
cards.text: Your Secrets trigger twice.

cards.flavor: 'What do you call two minions summoned at once? Twinions, haha! Wait... where are you going?'
cards.name: Khadgar
cards.text: Your cards that summon minions summon twice as many.

cards.flavor: The math checks out!
cards.name: Kirin Tor Tricaster
cards.text: Spell Damage +3 Your spells cost (1) more.

cards.flavor: If you have zero chill, this can help.
cards.name: Ray of Frost
cards.text: Twinspell Freeze a minion. If it's already Frozen, deal $2 damage to it.

cards.flavor: Mostly used for party tricks, to be honest.
cards.name: Power of Creation
cards.text: Discover a 6-Cost minion. Summon two copies of it.

cards.flavor: In another timeline, she was called Yeszari.
cards.name: Nozari
cards.text: Battlecry: Restore both heroes to full Health.

cards.flavor: No longer allowed to be “it” when playing demon tag.
cards.name: Portal Keeper
cards.text: Battlecry: Shuffle 3 Portals into your deck. When drawn, summon a 2/2 Demon with Rush.

cards.flavor: Plenty of buzz around this card.
cards.name: Shimmerfly
cards.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Hunter spell to your hand.

cards.flavor: Not sure I’d call it a good party if everyone ends up beside themselves.
cards.name: Hunting Party
cards.text: Copy all Beasts in your hand.

cards.flavor: When it comes to problem-solving, he always uses his head.
cards.name: Batterhead
cards.text: Rush. After this attacks and kills a minion, it may attack again.

cards.flavor: It’s coming from inside the deck!
cards.name: Plot Twist
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Draw that many cards.

cards.flavor: It'll put a good spin on your spells.
cards.name: Mana Cyclone
cards.text: Battlecry: For each spell you've cast this turn, add a random Mage spell to your hand.

cards.flavor: It's been programmed to include all the bear necessities.
cards.name: Ursatron
cards.text: Deathrattle: Draw a Mech from your deck.

cards.flavor: Imps don't get mad when you set them on fire. They think it's cozy.
cards.name: Impferno
cards.text: Give your Demons +1 Attack. Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions.

cards.flavor: You do not want to be on the business end of this intellect!
cards.name: EVIL Genius
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy a friendly minion to add 2 random Lackeys to your hand.

cards.flavor: Nobody else likes rush hour.
cards.name: Fel Lord Betrug
cards.text: Whenever you draw a minion, summon a copy  with Rush that dies at end of turn.

cards.flavor: The world is not ready for an illusion of this depth and intricacy!
cards.name: Magic Trick
cards.text: Discover a spell that costs (3) or less.

cards.flavor: He was once the Aspect of Magic but gave it up to focus on cheap tricks.
cards.name: Kalecgos
cards.text: Your first spell each turn costs (0). Battlecry: Discover a spell.

cards.flavor: Previously thought nonexistent.
cards.name: Soul of the Murloc
cards.text: Give your minions 'Deathrattle: Summon a 1/1 Murloc.'

cards.flavor: She’ll take anything you have—except scruples and a good work ethic.
cards.name: Underbelly Fence
cards.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a card from another class,  gain +1/+1 and Rush.

cards.flavor: A vengeful and vicarious vanguard against violent villains or vexed victims.
cards.name: Vendetta
cards.text: Deal $4 damage to a minion. Costs (0) if you're holding a card from another class.

cards.flavor: 'One for me and one for future me!'
cards.name: Tak Nozwhisker
cards.text: Whenever you shuffle a card into your deck, add a copy to your hand.

cards.flavor: Kobolds informally refer to its effect as a deathwaggle.
cards.name: Waggle Pick
cards.text: Deathrattle: Return a random friendly minion to your hand. It costs (2) less.

cards.flavor: She always manages to lift your spirits.
cards.name: Catrina Muerte
cards.text: At the end of your turn, summon a friendly minion that died this game.

cards.flavor: Please confirm your age before reading this flavor text.
cards.name: Forbidden Words
cards.text: Spend all your Mana. Destroy a minion with that much Attack or less.

cards.flavor: One's company, two's a crowd, and three's a “mass” resurrection, apparently.
cards.name: Mass Resurrection
cards.text: Summon 3 friendly minions that died this game.

cards.flavor: Wanna know how he got those scars? So does he.
cards.name: Scargil
cards.text: Your Murlocs cost (1).

cards.flavor: Even the smallest minion can change the outcome of the game.
cards.name: Call to Adventure
cards.text: Draw the lowest Cost minion from your deck. Give it +2/+2.

cards.flavor: Impossible to cast without cackling evilly.
cards.name: Daring Escape
cards.text: Return all friendly minions to your hand.

cards.flavor: Of course she knows the future, she’s been looking at your cards the WHOLE TIME!
cards.name: Madame Lazul
cards.text: Battlecry: Discover a copy of a card in your opponent's hand.

cards.flavor: If you don’t fight to the death, it’s Duel Yielding.
cards.name: Duel!
cards.text: Summon a minion from each player's deck. They fight!

cards.flavor: Keeps your choices handy.
cards.name: Keeper Stalladris
cards.text: After you cast a Choose One spell, add copies of both choices to your hand.

cards.flavor: They're a nightmare to deal with.
cards.name: Dreamway Guardians
cards.text: Summon two 1/2 Dryads with Lifesteal.

cards.flavor: Don't make her raise her 'shush'!
cards.name: Dalaran Librarian
cards.text: Battlecry: Silence adjacent minions.

cards.flavor: Your deck is just another organizational challenge to her.
cards.name: Archivist Elysiana
cards.text: Battlecry: Discover 5 cards. Replace your deck with 2 copies of each.

cards.flavor: And your minions with mega-windfury get... dizzy.
cards.name: Whirlwind Tempest
cards.text: Your minions with Windfury have Mega-Windfury.

cards.flavor: This is CLEARLY their first rodeo.
cards.name: Hench-Clan Hogsteed
cards.text: Rush Deathrattle: Summon a 1/1 Murloc.

cards.flavor: When you need to rage anonymously.
cards.name: Faceless Rager
cards.text: Battlecry: Copy a friendly minion's Health.

cards.flavor: Your gryphon will be summoned following a brief safety demonstration.
cards.name: Flight Master
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 2/2 Gryphon for each player.

cards.flavor: If it soaks too long, it becomes a reservoir hog.
cards.name: Mana Reservoir
cards.text: Spell Damage +1

cards.flavor: Mwahahaha! You'll never catch him this time!
cards.name: Recurring Villain
cards.text: Deathrattle: If this minion has 4 or more Attack, resummon it.

cards.flavor: Does he summon because of his madness, or is he mad from all the summoning?
cards.name: Mad Summoner
cards.text: Battlecry: Fill each player's board with 1/1 Imps.

cards.flavor: “I’m a real toy now!”
cards.name: Jepetto Joybuzz
cards.text: Battlecry: Draw 2 minions from your deck. Set their Attack, Health, and Cost to 1.

cards.flavor: It begs for scraps.
cards.name: Vicious Scraphound
cards.text: Whenever this minion deals damage, gain that much Armor.

cards.flavor: Shovel beats paper and rock!
cards.name: Burly Shovelfist
cards.text: Rush

cards.flavor: 'The beatings will continue until MY morale improves.'
cards.name: Improve Morale
cards.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If it survives, add a Lackey to your hand.

cards.flavor: The Alpha Devastator didn’t devastate enough. The Beta Devastator devastated too much. But the Omega was just right!
cards.name: Omega Devastator
cards.text: Battlecry: If you have 10 Mana Crystals, deal 10 damage to a minion.

cards.flavor: His allies call him invaluable.
cards.name: Soldier of Fortune
cards.text: Whenever this minion attacks, give your opponent a Coin.

cards.flavor: Its small yet fierce riders are affectionately known as rug rats.
cards.name: Magic Carpet
cards.text: After you play a 1-Cost minion, give it +1 Attack and Rush.

cards.flavor: *Taps roof of mammoth* “You can fit so many squirrels in this thing!”
cards.name: Exotic Mountseller
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a random 3-Cost Beast.

cards.flavor: And you always thought they wore the candles just for fun.
cards.name: Tunnel Blaster
cards.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Deal 3 damage to all minions.

cards.collectionText: Rush. Battlecry: If you've restored 5 Health this game, summon a copy of this.
cards.flavor: Arrives alone, but usually leaves with a friend just like him.
cards.name: Crystal Stag
cards.text: Rush. Battlecry: If you've restored 5 Health this game, summon a copy of this.@ ({0} left!)@ (Ready!)
